did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: The collection includes financial statements of condition for 1922 and 1927 for The Maxwell Land Grant Company; a bound 142 page Decree Index for the Springer Ditch Company vs. the French Land and Irrigation Company in the District Court of the Eighth Judicial District, Colfax County, New Mexico; two deeds to lots in Cimarron, New Mexico; one letter; a sectional map; a booklet of mining regulations of The Maxwell Land Grant Company; and a Patent for a land claim of Charles Beaubien and Guadalupe Miranda in New Mexico.

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

prefercite.head: Credit Line
prefercite.p: Maxwell Land Grant Company Collection(MS 323).Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection includes financial statements of condition for 1922 and 1927 for The Maxwell Land Grant Company; a bound 142 page Decree Index for the Springer Ditch Company vs. the French Land and Irrigation Company in the District Court of the Eighth Judicial District, Colfax County, New Mexico; two deeds to lots in Cimarron, New Mexico; one letter; a sectional map; a booklet of mining regulations of The Maxwell Land Grant Company; and a Patent for a land claim of Charles Beaubien and Guadalupe Miranda in New Mexico.

controlaccess.corpname: Maxwell Land Grant Company -- Records and correspondence
controlaccess.subject: Land grants -- New Mexico
controlaccess.geogname: Maxwell Land Grant (N.M. and Colo.) -- History

did.unittitle: Jaarverslag van "The Maxwell Land Grant Company," financial statements, 1922 and 1927, in Dutch. 1922-1927
Decree Index: Springer Ditch Company vs. French Land and Irrigation Company, 1929. 1929
Two deeds, 1871; one letter from Frank Springer to Edward L. Bartlett, 1891. 1891
Sectional map of Colfax and Mora Counties, New Mexico, 1889. 1889
Brochure, "Mining Regulations of Maxwell Land Grant Company" 1901. 1901

Patent confirming land claim of Charles Beaubien and Guadalupe Miranda, situated principally in the Territory of New Mexico (Taos County), and partially in the State of Colorado; confirmed as Private Land Claim number fifteen; and recorded in Colfax County Deed Book "B," pages 210 to 219, 18 July 1879. July 18, 1879
